credit_line: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund and through gift of Mrs. Edward Stern
dimensions: 18 x 18 cm (7 1/16 x 7 1/16 in.) fringed on all sides
title: Flora's Retinue: Rose
medium:
Medium: linen warp, silk weft
Technique: 4 & 1 satin damask
description: Small square doily, fringed on all sides, with an ivory linen warp and a bronze-colored silk weft. A figure of a woman dressed as a rose with and sitting on the stem of a large rose, with the word ROSE in the upper left, all appearing in ivory on a bronze ground. A set of six, the doilies would have been used on the table as part of a dessert service.
name: Doily
